abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is rated
            unsatisfactory, sustainability unlikely, although
            institutional development impacts are modest; and, while the
            Bank performance, overall, is rated satisfactory, its
            performance during implementation was unsatisfactory based
            on two facts: a) the lack of Bank staff continuity in
            project supervision (5 task team leaders in four years);
            and, 2) the PSR did not always reflect the gravity of the
            problems affecting the project. Conversely, the Borrower
            performance is rated unsatisfactory, for although the
            Borrower's performance during preparation was
            satisfactory, the institutional instability led to
            insufficient support from the highest level of Government.
            Lessons convey the following. Project specific lessons
            highlight the lack of political leadership, in particular,
            because it worsened difficulties between the two
            governmental bodies in charge of the project implementation:
            the resistance of the Autonomous Literacy Service - SAA - to
            the new approach could only be eliminated, or eased by means
            of strong political leadership. This lack of political
            leadership, aggravated the establishment of new
            institutional framework arrangements; instead, on the basis
            of existing institutions, arrangements could have been
            built, avoiding institutional conflicts. Moreover, the
            program lacked an adequate assessment of literacy providers.
            Therefore, strengthening training activities is crucial to
            facilitating implementation, and avoiding most of the
            problems experienced. Lessons of specific value for the Bank
            point at the "Quality of Supervision Assessment"
            (QSA6) report, which observed in some specific cases, that
            conclusions included in "Aide Memoirs" and
            Back-to-Office Reports, were not always reflected in the
            performance ratings.
